events.title: Repeal of the Stamp Act
events.description: The British Parliament repealed the Stamp Act, a tax enacted on the American colonies that had sparked widespread protest and unrest.
events.significance: This repeal marked a temporary easing of tensions between Britain and the American colonies, but the conflict eventually led to the American Revolution.

events.title: The Zollverein Established
events.description: The German Customs Union (Zollverein) was established under Prussian leadership, promoting economic unity among German states by abolishing internal tariffs.
events.significance: It laid the groundwork for the eventual political unification of Germany by fostering economic cooperation.

events.title: Fascists March on Rome
events.description: Benito Mussolini's National Fascist Party organized the 'March on Rome,' a coup which led King Victor Emmanuel III to appoint Mussolini as Prime Minister of Italy.
events.significance: This event marked the beginning of fascist rule in Italy and significantly influenced European politics leading up to World War II.

events.title: Soviet Cosmonaut Aleksei Leonov Performs First Spacewalk
events.description: Aleksei Leonov became the first human to conduct a spacewalk (extravehicular activity) during the Voskhod 2 mission.
events.significance: This milestone advanced human capabilities in space exploration and technology.

events.title: Lithuania Declares Independence from the Soviet Union
events.description: Lithuania became the first Soviet republic to declare independence, challenging Soviet authority and inspiring other republics to do the same.
events.significance: This was a key event in the dissolution of the Soviet Union and the re-emergence of independent Baltic states.
